entry.title: that something lovers call fate
entry.summary:
Author: theramblingwriter

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,928Chapters: 3/17Kudos: 7

Summary: Buck and Eddie first meet in 2016 when Eddie needs a partner to drive with him and his son from El Paso to LA where he's moving to be with his girlfriend and start a new life with the LAFD.He doesn't think he and Buck are destined to be friends. They probably won't think about each other again.Two years later Buck and Eddie run into each other when Eddie is at a cafe with his wife.Buck wonders if this is the universe giving them a second chance to get to know each other. Neither of them take it.Three more years pass by before they meet again.Eddie transfers to the 118 after his divorce, and Buck's still mourning an unexpected breakup with his girlfriend… but this time, things just seem to click.

entry.title: shake it off, stay alive, open wide
entry.summary:
Author: dogfishmonger

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,228Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 30

Summary: He feels like shit when he's hungry, and he plays better when he's empty. The cold air doesn't touch him as much. The floodlights turn silvery-soft.And he likes eating. Keeps his hands busy, mouth busy, mind busy. Something to chew through, putty in the ears.Go until you can't anymore. Cycle it back out. Be ready.  --OR: Buck's had on-again, off-again bulimia since he was 14.--Updates on Wednesdays. Title from Psychic Friend's "We Do Not Belong"

entry.title: The Boyfriend Experiment
entry.summary:
Author: aurehose

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,810Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 33

Summary: To get his family off his back, Eddie asks his childhood best friend, Buck, to pretend to be his boyfriend. It’s supposed to be simple—just an act. But Buck is too good at it, and Eddie starts forgetting where the lie ends and the truth begins. Between lingering touches, family gatherings, and sharing a bed, Eddie realizes he might have been in love with Buck all along. But is Buck just pretending—or has he been waiting for Eddie to figure it out? If you love fake dating, oblivious idiots, and two people falling in love while pretending they aren’t, then this is for you. Buck and Eddie are about to learn the hard way that sometimes, faking it means feeling it.

Author: guyersmariano

entry.title: smoke and shadows
entry.summary:
Author: jio0021

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,079Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 105

Summary: "Name?" she asked, hands ready to catch the life entering this world."Evan," Phillip bit out.Ravena almost laughed. Youth. So predictable."Magic?""Healing," they answered in unison.Ravena hesitated. A foolish idea took root. The child was strong. Late. Capable of holding more. Why not? The Buckleys barely understood the process. They knew enough to seek her out, to make their shady deals, but not enough to comprehend what she truly did. They would never know.She wove both gifts into the infant’s fragile form—healing and protection. Twice the power. Twice the burden. Twice the suffering.For the next five years, Daniel thrived, his sickness fading into nothing.For the next five years, Evan withered.

entry.title: Through Fire and Water
entry.summary:
Author: zeetazks_341

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,339Chapters: 2/20Kudos: 12

Summary: Eddie disappears without a trace after responding to what seemed like a routine emergency call. The only clue left behind is a single, chilling message: “Stay out of it.” But Buck has never been one to stay out of anything—especially not when it comes to Eddie.As Buck, the 118, and even the LAPD scramble to find Eddie, the case takes a dark turn. His kidnapping isn’t random—it’s personal. Someone from Eddie’s past has come back, and they’re willing to do whatever it takes to make him suffer. With time running out, Buck refuses to sit on the sidelines. He’ll risk everything—his job, his life, his heart—to bring Eddie home.But when Eddie finally returns, nothing is the same. The trauma, the unspoken words, the near-loss—they change everything. And Buck realizes that the fear of losing Eddie has finally made him face the truth: he’s been in love with him all along.

entry.title: And The Truth Behind Them
entry.summary:
Author: lexaproeddie

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,485Chapters: 1/5Kudos: 19

Summary: “Buck…” It was off his tongue like he was reciting a prayer, like Buck was a saint, and Eddie a sinner begging for a chance for redemption. Buck’s eyes were wide, his mouth hung open a little, and then he swallowed and sucked in a harsh breath. “Eddie?” Buck said his name like it was the melody to a sad song, like it was the minor key, and a sorrowful poem that shook apart nations. Eddie wanted to fling himself at him, wanted to throw his body with the faith that Buck would catch him, and he wanted to kiss him until he couldn’t breathe anymore. He hadn’t realized his empty- how hollow he had been feeling until Buck was standing in front of him. Eddie shattered Buck's heart two years ago, and as fate would have it they were once again face to face with each other. Will they be able to move on, or will hurt of the lies in the past tear them apart....again.
